episodeTitle: I Won't Kick Even if it Costs Me My Life! Sanji's Chivalry!
episodeTitleJapanese: 死んでも蹴らん！サンジ男の騎士道！
episodeTitleRomanized: Shinde mo Keran! Sanji Otoko no Kishidō!
description: Kaku uses his giraffe transformation to bisect the Tower of Justice, trapping Zoro and Sogeking together with seastone handcuffs. Nami narrowly escapes from Kumadori and steals his key. Sanji confronts Kalifa but refuses to attack her due to his chivalrous code, despite her brutal attacks using her bubble powers. After Sanji is defeated and thrown through the ceiling, Nami vows to battle Kalifa herself.

events.title: Kaku Bisects the Tower of Justice
events.description: Kaku, frustrated by everyone laughing at his giraffe form, unleashes his powerful Rankyaku: Amane Dachi technique. By spinning his elongated giraffe neck, he creates a devastating cutting attack that cleanly slices the entire Tower of Justice in half, causing the top portion to shift dramatically.
events.significance: Demonstrates the immense destructive power of Kaku's giraffe Devil Fruit when combined with his CP9 techniques. This attack showcases how Zoan Devil Fruits can enhance Rokushiki abilities to devastating effect.

quotes.speaker: Kaku
quotes.context: Kaku loses his temper after being mocked for his giraffe transformation

events.title: Zoro and Sogeking Handcuffed Together
events.description: When Sogeking attempts to use seastone handcuffs against the CP9 agents, his poor aim causes him to accidentally handcuff himself to Zoro's right arm instead. The pair realize they are now forced to fight together while physically bound.
events.significance: Creates a comedic yet challenging situation that forces Zoro and Usopp to coordinate their movements. This handicap adds difficulty to their already dangerous battle against two powerful CP9 agents.

quotes.text: You idiot! How did you manage to handcuff us together?!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro realizes Sogeking has handcuffed them together

events.title: Nami Escapes from Kumadori
events.description: Using her agility and cunning, Nami manages to escape from Kumadori's clutches. During her escape, she successfully steals the key he was carrying, though she loses her jacket in the process.
events.significance: Nami acquires one of the CP9 keys needed to free Robin, advancing the Straw Hats' rescue mission. This demonstrates Nami's resourcefulness even against a physically superior opponent.

events.title: Kumadori Displays Seimei Kikan Techniques
events.description: Kumadori demonstrates his mastery of Seimei Kikan (Life Return), a technique that grants complete control over all body parts. He uses Kami Shibari to manipulate his hair like tentacles and Haru Gin Jo to control his body's digestion and form.
events.significance: Reveals the advanced CP9 technique of Seimei Kikan, showing that CP9 agents have abilities beyond the standard Rokushiki. This technique allows supernatural control over one's own body.

quotes.text: After a thousand years in the ocean and another thousand in the mountains, I mastered Seimei Kikan!
quotes.speaker: Kumadori
quotes.context: Kumadori explains his training and technique

events.title: Franky Boxing Debut
events.description: Franky demonstrates his Franky Boxing technique against Fukurou. Despite being standard boxing maneuvers, Franky's steel fists combined with his cyborg strength make his punches devastatingly powerful.
events.significance: Showcases Franky's fighting style that combines his shipwright boxing skills with his cyborg enhancements, establishing him as a formidable hand-to-hand combatant.

events.title: Sanji Confronts Kalifa
events.description: Sanji enters Kalifa's room seeking the key to free Robin. However, he immediately faces an internal conflict - Kalifa is a woman, and his code of chivalry absolutely forbids him from attacking women, even enemies threatening his crew.
events.significance: Sets up one of the most controversial moments in Sanji's character arc, where his personal code directly conflicts with his crew's mission. This battle will test the limits of Sanji's principles.

quotes.text: I need that key... but she's a woman.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji realizes the dilemma he faces

events.title: Sanji's Chivalry Code Explained
events.description: As Sanji struggles with his inability to fight Kalifa, he emotionally explains that his code of chivalry was beaten into him from childhood. He tearfully confesses that even if it costs him his life, he will never raise his foot to kick a woman.
events.significance: Provides crucial context for Sanji's character and his unwavering adherence to this principle. This moment reveals the deep psychological roots of his behavior, stemming from his upbringing and mentor Zeff's teachings.

quotes.text: Even if I die... I will never kick a woman!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji declares his absolute commitment to his code of chivalry

quotes.text: This chivalry was beaten into me as a kid.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji reveals the origin of his code

events.title: Kalifa Uses Awa Awa no Mi Powers on Sanji
events.description: Kalifa mercilessly attacks the defenseless Sanji with her Awa Awa no Mi (Bubble-Bubble Fruit) powers. She spreads soap bubbles across his body, which drain his physical strength and make his skin extremely smooth and slippery, rendering him unable to move or defend himself.
events.significance: Demonstrates the strategic versatility of Kalifa's Devil Fruit ability. The power to 'clean' strength from opponents is shown to be devastating against someone who refuses to fight back.

quotes.speaker: Kalifa
quotes.context: Kalifa uses her bubble powers on Sanji

events.title: Sanji's Defeat
events.description: Completely drained of strength by Kalifa's bubble powers and unable to defend himself due to his code, Sanji is brutally beaten. Kalifa delivers a final kick that sends him crashing through the ceiling, leaving him unconscious and defeated.
events.significance: Marks one of Sanji's most devastating losses. His adherence to his principles results in complete defeat, demonstrating that his code of chivalry can be a serious liability even when his crew's lives are at stake.

events.title: Nami Vows to Fight Kalifa
events.description: Witnessing Sanji's broken and defeated body falling through the ceiling, Nami is filled with rage. She declares that she will take over the fight against Kalifa, vowing to defeat the CP9 agent who hurt her crewmate.
events.significance: Sets up the upcoming Nami vs. Kalifa battle and showcases the bond between the Straw Hat crew members. Nami's determination to avenge Sanji demonstrates her growth as a fighter and her loyalty to her crew.

quotes.text: Sanji... I'll make her pay for what she did to you!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami sees Sanji's defeated state and vows revenge

quotes.text: Even if I die... I will never kick a woman!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji declares his absolute commitment to his code of chivalry

quotes.text: This chivalry was beaten into me as a kid.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji reveals the origin of his code

quotes.speaker: Kaku
quotes.context: Kaku loses his temper after being mocked for his giraffe transformation

themes.description: The episode explores the conflict between personal principles and practical necessity. Sanji's unwavering adherence to his chivalrous code results in his defeat, raising questions about when principles become liabilities.
themes.symbolism: Sanji's defeat symbolizes the potential cost of inflexible principles, even noble ones.
culturalReferences: The concept of honor in Japanese culture

themes.description: Despite being defeated, Sanji maintains his principles to avoid violating his personal code. Nami's response shows how the crew supports each other when one member cannot continue.
themes.symbolism: The passing of the battle from Sanji to Nami represents the crew's ability to cover each other's weaknesses.

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji faces perhaps his greatest character test - his code of chivalry preventing him from fighting to save Robin. His defeat highlights both his noble nature and the practical limitations of his principles.
keyActions: Refuses to attack despite the stakes
Suffers complete defeat while maintaining his principles
quotes: Even if I die... I will never kick a woman!
This chivalry was beaten into me as a kid.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her growth as both a fighter and crew member by volunteering to take on a powerful CP9 agent to avenge Sanji and continue the mission.
quotes: Sanji... I'll make her pay for what she did to you!

characterSpotlights.development: Kaku shows that despite the comedic appearance of his giraffe form, he is extremely dangerous when combining his Zoan powers with CP9 techniques.
keyActions: Bisects the Tower of Justice with Rankyaku
Creates chaos that leads to Zoro and Sogeking being handcuffed

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the scenes of Sanji's internal conflict and Kalifa's attacks for dramatic effect.

trivia.fact: This episode has one of the highest controversy ratings among fans due to Sanji's refusal to fight Kalifa even with Robin's life at stake.
The episode eyecatcher features Sanji and Nami, foreshadowing the transition of the battle from Sanji to Nami.
This episode aired during the period when One Piece stopped using ending songs (episodes 279-1070), extending the opening theme instead.

sources.title: Why did the anime stop having ending songs since episode 279?

trivia.fact: The episode achieved a TV rating of 8.1%, ranking 6th in its timeslot.
